comment.author: 39967544@N00
comment._content:
These images show the paddle steamer Newcastle (built 1884, became a hulk in 1928 and scuttled in 1933). It ran a passenger service between Sydney and Newcastle.
And a view from the American Matson Company's luxury cruise liner Malolo which was built in 1927 and visited Australia' East Coast in December 1929 on a Pacific cruise.  After World War 2 it was sold to Greek owners who renamed it Queen Frederica: as such it visited Australia quite often in the 1960s as a migrant and cruise ship.
